text.title: Make Kefta and Batata (Meat and Potatoes Lebanese Style)

head.s: Make Kefta and Batata ( Meat and Potatoes Lebanese Style )

text.s: Kefta and batata , also known as “ kefta bi seniyah , ” which means in English kefta in a pan .
Kefta is a traditional Lebanese casserole that many grandmothers have been making for centuries .
Kefta is ground meat mixed in with chopped onions and parsley .
It 's super fast and easy to make , kefta is shaped into patties topped with potatoes and onions simmered with seasoned tomato paste .
This traditional Lebanese casserole is served with white vermicelli rice , and/or baked Lebanese bread .
This wikiHow will teach you how to make kefta and batata .

item.s: ¾ lb .
Kefta
3 Potatoes
4 tsp .
Tomato Paste
2 ½ cups water
1 cube chicken bouillon/ or chicken broth
2 tsp .
Salt
1 tsp .
Black Pepper
1 T. Vegetable oils or coconut oil
Dill(optional )
.5 tsp . Thyme(optional )
.5 tsp .
Basil(optional )
2 cups medium grain rice
1 cup broken vermicelli pasta
2 ½ T. olive oil
1 tsp . salt
Wash your hands before touching the kefta .
You do not want to touch kefta and then touch the rest of the ingredients .
This will avoid any food-borne illness .
Form the kefta into circular patties with your hands .
You can make them as small or large as you want just depending on how large your casserole dish is .
Then place your kefta on the side on a separate plate .
Preheat your oven to 375F .
Spray your casserole dish with PAM or use coconut/vegetable oil .
Grab a separate casserole dish .
Then wash your potatoes and either peel or leave the skin depending on your preference .
Some people like to soak the potatoes for at least 15 mins before laying them on top of the kefta .
Let the potatoes soak for 15 minutes .
Then peel and slice them into ¼ inch thickness .
You want them to look like flying saucers .
Sprinkle the potatoes with salt and drizzle vegetable oil .
Lay on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or even just aluminium foil .
You can also add onion powder and dill for extra flavor ( optional ) .
Start baking the potatoes before the kefta .
It does take the potatoes a little longer to cook than the meat , you want everything to be cooked evenly .
Bake the potatoes in the oven for 25/30 minutes on 375F .
Flip the potatoes over halfway through baking .
If you soaked your potatoes before it might take less then 30 mins for them to turn a little brown .
Place the potatoes in too of the kefta patties .
You can do this once the potatoes have been in the oven for about 25/30 mins and are brown .
Add sliced ¼ thick onions and tomatoes on top if you desire .
Grab a separate bowl .
Add the tomato paste and dissolve it with water .
Stir the two ingredients for about 3 minutes then add in the chicken bouillon and stir for another 3 minutes .
You might want to add some extra seasoning .
Pour the mixture on top of the casserole .
Do not get worried that there is a lot of liquid it will dissolve .
Season with salt and pepper and then cover with aluminium foil and bake for 45 minutes on 375F .
Continue to check on the casserole halfway .
Make the rice and baked bread .
Rinse the rice , and let it soak in water for about 15-20 minutes .
Then grab a medium non-stick cooking pot , heat the olive oil and low/medium and add the vermicelli and stir continuously .
Add in the rice and continue to stir .
Add in 3 ½ cups of water and bring to a boil until the water is reduced , then turn heat to low .
Cook for 15-20 minutes while the kefta is still in the oven .
Remove the kefta from the oven after 45-50 minutes .
You may then add a piece of Lebanese bread on the plate along with the rice and top the kefta for a fine garnish .
If you do not have chicken bouillon you can use chicken broth .
Again , that is totally optional for you .
You can also add extra vegetables on top for extra flavor .
If you would like to add a different vegetable depending on the preference you may ( ex . zucchini , eggplant ) .
When adding the vermicelli , you have to make sure you keep an eye on it and stir continuously or it will burn and you will have to throw away and start all over .
Let the Kefta sit for about 10 minutes before eating because it will be extremely hot .
